__TOC__

MythTV provides full support for the HDHomeRun hardware.

 1) Open mythtv-setup.
 <pre>
mythtv-setup
</pre>
 2) Set up the General page to your liking.
 
 3) Choose Capture Cards.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|5> <nowiki>[[File:capture_1.png]]</nowiki>
| Card type: HDHomeRun DTV tuner box
|-
| Device ID: <number from back of HDHomeRun>
|-
| Tuner: 0
|-
| Finish: <enter>
|-
| Shortcut - if there is only one HDHomeRun on the local network you can use the wildcard FFFFFFFF device ID.
|}
Repeat adding second capture card for tuner 1  
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|4> <nowiki>[[File:capture_return_1.png]]</nowiki>
| Card type: HDHomeRun DTV tuner box
|-
| Device ID: <number from back of HDHomeRun>
|-
| Tuner: 1
|-
| Finish: <enter>
|}

==== OTA (Digital Antenna) ====
 4) Choose video sources
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|3> <nowiki>[[File:video_1.png]]</nowiki>
| Video source name: Digital Antenna
|-
| Listings grabber: No grabber (will come back and change this later)
|-
| Channel frequency table: us-bcast
|}

 5) Choose input connections 
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|4> <nowiki>[[File:input_1.png]]</nowiki>
| Video source name: Digital Antenna
|-
| External channel change command: <blank>
|-
| Preset tuner to channel: <blank>
|-
| Scan for channels: <enter>
|}

 6) Scan for channels page
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|6> <nowiki>[[File:scan_1.png]]</nowiki>
| Scan type: Full scan
|-
| Frequency table: Broadcast
|-
| ATSC modulation: Terrestrial (8-VSB)
|-
| Channel seperator: Period
|-
| Existing channel treatment: Minimal updates
|-
| Next: <enter>
|}

 7) Return to "Connect source to input page":
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:input_return_1.png]]</nowiki>
| Make sure that starting channel is a valid channel number
|-
| Finish <enter>
|}

 8) Repeat steps 3-6 for for HDHomeRun Port 1.

 9) Choose the channel editor
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <nowiki>[[File:channel_1.png]]</nowiki>
| Note list of channels for source "Digital Antenna"
|}

 10) Open up an account with Tribune Media Services Zap2It.
  Create an account here:
   http://labs.zap2it.com/
  Create a channel lineup and enable/disable channels based on channels listed in the Channel Editor in mythtv-setup.

 11) Choose Video sources
Change the configuration for '''Digital Antenna''' as follows:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|6> <nowiki>[[File:video_return_1.png]]</nowiki>
| Listings grabber: North America (DataDirect) (Internal)
|-
| User id: <login name for zap2it>
|-
| Password: <password for zap2it>
|-
| Retrieve lineups: <enter>
|-
| Data direct lineup: <select correct listing>
|-
| Finish <enter>
|}

==== Digital Cable ====
 4) Choose video sources
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|3> <nowiki>[[File:video_2.png]]</nowiki>
| Video source name: Digital Cable
|-
| Listings grabber: No grabber (will come back and change this later)
|-
| Channel frequency table: us-cable
|}

 5) Choose input connections 
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|4> <nowiki>[[File:input_2.png]]</nowiki>
| Video source name: Digital Cable
|-
| External channel change command: <blank>
|-
| Preset tuner to channel: <blank>
|-
| Scan for channels: <enter>
|}

 6) Scan for channels page (QAM-256)
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|6> <nowiki>[[File:scan_2.png]]</nowiki>
| Scan type: Full scan
|-
| Frequency table: Cable
|-
| ATSC modulation: QAM-256
|-
| Channel seperator: Period
|-
| Existing channel treatment: Minimal updates
|-
| Next: <enter>
|}

 7) Return to "Connect source to input page".  Choose to scan for channels again.

 8) Scan for channels page (QAM-64)
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|6> <nowiki>[[File:scan_return_2.png]]</nowiki>
| Scan type: Full scan
|-
| Frequency table: Cable
|-
| ATSC modulation: QAM-64
|-
| Channel seperator: Period
|-
| Existing channel treatment: Minimal updates
|-
| Next: <enter>
|}

 9) Return to "Connect source to input page":
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:input_return_2.png]]</nowiki>
| Make sure that starting channel is a valid channel number
|-
| Finish <enter>
|}

 10) Repeat steps 3-6 for for HDHomeRun Port 1.

 11) Choose the channel editor
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <nowiki>[[File:channel_2.png]]</nowiki>
| Note list of channels for source "Digital Cable"
|}

 12) Open up an account with Tribune Media Services Zap2It.
  Create an account here:
   http://labs.zap2it.com/
  Create a channel lineup and enable/disable channels based on channels listed in the Channel Editor in mythtv-setup.
  Note that MythTV uses the ATSC channel numbering as specified in the transport stream, not the remapped cable channel numbering so you will need to select OTA/Antenna as the source in Zap2it.

 13) Choose Video sources
Change the configuration for '''Digital Cable''' as follows:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|6> <nowiki>[[File:video_return_2.png]]</nowiki>
| Listings grabber: North America (DataDirect) (Internal)
|-
| User id: <login name for zap2it>
|-
| Password: <password for zap2it>
|-
| Retrieve lineups: <enter>
|-
| Data direct lineup: <select correct listing>
|-
| Finish <enter>
|}
